entry.title: Start service worker when running_status is STARTING
entry.content:
Now we implemented a service worker warm-up mechanism. It's possible

that STARTING status doesn't automatically proceed to RUNNING status if

the service worker is warmed-up.

entry.title: shortcuts: Ignore generated accelerators when counting towards maximum
entry.content:
Generated accelerators are informational to the users but are not

"real" accelerators that were added by either the system or

the user. This change allows users to continue to add up to 5

original accelerators per action.

entry.title: [LCPP] Pageload.Clients.LCPP.PaintTiming.NavigationOrActivationToFirstContentfulPaint UMA
entry.content:
This CL extends LcpCriticalPathPredictorPageLoadMetricsObserver so that

it would emit the Pageload.Clients.LCPP.PaintTiming.NavigationOrActivationToFirstContentfulPaint UMA.



For the PLMO to know if the LCPP hint is available for a particular `NavigationRequest`, this CL introduces `NavigationHandle::GetLCPPNavigationHint`.

entry.title: [BRP] Increase BRP coverage: ViewBuilder::CopyAddressTo
entry.content:
This CL rewrites `RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION T*` to `raw_ptr`.



The targeted fields are originally excluded from the `raw_ptr`

rewrite because they are given to `ViewBuilder::CopyAddressTo(View**)`.

Now `ViewBuilder::CopyAddressTo(View**)` takes `raw_ptr*` as an

argument so no need to exclude these fields.



`raw_ptr` is tagged with `DanglingUntriaged` if it is dangling.

`raw_ptr` is tagged with `ExperimentalAsh` if it is in Ash code.





Change-Id: I60f8094247ccf138bd3a2b56c99994b56dcf20b5

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon.""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1684863bd213bd871fc22367e9382dfcf7cb17a3.



Reason for revert: b/294389366 tast.security.SharedFilesystemState failing blocking uprev



Original change's description:

> Reland "Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon."

>

> This reverts commit fdae4242269517798487e60f518336aeb5c53ac5.

>

> Reason for revert: With a fix of initialization issue.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Revert "Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon."

> >

> > This reverts commit 3f230b34cb1c992a6fbb11132c17228619f06692.

> >

> > Reason for revert: Possible culprit for UAF errors in tests in

> > builder: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests

> >

> > Original change's description:

> > > Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon.

> > >

> > > In its GetInstance(), it keeps the raw ptr in its static local

> > > variable, while it returns scoped_refptr.

> > > When all scoped_refptrs referring the instance are destroyed,

> > > the instance is also destroyed, so the static local pointer will

> > > gets dangling pointer.

> > > Fortunately, we didn't hit the case in production/tests,

> > > but following fix of tests will hit the issue.

> > >

> > > This CL initializes/shutdowns explicitly to avoid the case.

entry.title: Remove print job check on content analysis state changes
entry.content:
Attempting to ensure that there isn't a pending print job when the

content analysis state changes is too strict. It is possible that

for back-to-back print jobs, OpportunisticallyCreatePrintJob() called

early for the second job could return early because `print_job_` is

still set from the first print job. This can lead to some overlap in

the processing between the two jobs. set_analyzing_content() does not

have enough context to know that `print_job_` could be for a different

one than what the current analysis is ultimately for.



This effectively reverts the changes made in https://crrev.com/c/4704792

and https://crrev.com/c/4735072.



Bug: 1464566, 1468969

entry.title: Explicitly check when local time conversion fails.
entry.content:
base::Time::LocalExplode() can fail. The API says to check

base::Time::Exploded::HasValidValues() to detect this.



This functionally is probably the same as before because we

were passing the exploded output to base::Time::FromLocalExploded()

immediately after, and presumably, that would fail if the exploded

input had invalid values. But it's clearer to the reader if this

is explicitly checked first.



A unit test has also been added to TimeOfDay.

entry.title: Call CreateNetworkContextInNetworkService in SystemNetworkContextManager
entry.content:
Rather than calling directly to the network service remote, network

contexts should be created using the

CreateNetworkContextInNetworkService to ensure that appropriate

initialization such as socket broker connection occurs.



On Android, since CreateNetworkContextInNetworkService is called early

during init from DownloadManagerService, the thread checks in the

function are made consistent with other functions in

network_service_instance_impl.cc.



This is covered by existing tests, namely

SystemNetworkContext/NetworkContextConfigurationBrowserTest* when

run with network sandbox enabled.



BUG=1469732

entry.title: views: make ViewTargeter::delegate_ never dangle
entry.content:
There are two patterns with subtle lifetime issues that ViewTargeter is

prone to. This CL removes instances of both patterns and then enables

raw_ptr enforcement for ViewTargeter::delegate_ to ensure they do not

recur.



The first involves a single view V. If:

* V is a subclass of View

* That subclass has a member of type ViewTargeterDelegate (or a

unique_ptr to same)

* That ViewTargeterDelegate is used as the delegate for V's own

ViewTargeter

Then during destruction of V, the subclass destructor will destroy the

ViewTargeterDelegate member of V while the ViewTargeter (which doesn't

get destroyed until ~View runs) is still live. That violates

ViewTargeter's requirement that ViewTargeterDelegate outlive it. That

can be fixed by either making V itself a ViewTargeterDelegate (when

possible) or passing ownership of a separate ViewTargeterDelegate to

ViewTargeter.



The second involves BrowserView specifically. BrowserView has some

methods which manufacture other Views; these Views have lifetimes that

are generally unrelated to the BrowserView. In two cases, BrowserView

was creating ViewTargeters which used a member of the BrowserView as

their ViewTargeterDelegate, and installing these ViewTargeters into

Views it was manufacturing. This pattern binds the lifetimes of the

returned Views to BrowserView: they must be destroyed before the

BrowserView is, so that their ViewTargeters do not outlive their

ViewTargeterDelegates (which are owned by the BrowserView). That is not

actually guaranteed, and in practice is violated by the overlay views,

which are not descendants of BrowserView in the View tree. Even in the

cases where the returned Views do not outlive BrowserView, this is a

dangerous hidden coupling of the lifetimes of the two classes.



To avoid that, this change:

* Gives ViewTargeter a mode in which it takes ownership of the provided

Delegate

* Has BrowserView not retain ownership of the ViewTargeterDelegates it

creates, so that the lifetimes of the Views using those delegates are

not bound to BrowserView

* Has UninstallCheckboxView not retain ownership of the

ViewTargeterDelegate it creates



That solves the dangling raw_ptr crash, and also simplifies the object

graph for BrowserView: the ViewTargeterDelegates are not referenced by

BrowserView after they are created, and are instead simply owned by the

ViewTargeters which use them, so the returned Views from

Create*OverlayView() are now truly "standalone".



Bug: 1469136

Change-Id: I262d1b9f452b75435aac8bef2bd0598d36b1f126

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4743067

entry.title: views: remove broken ImageView repaint optimization
entry.content:
ImageView caches a raw pointer to the underlying pixels of the bitmap of

the image it has been passed. When ImageView::SetImage() is called, if

that cached raw pointer is equal to the backing bitmap of the new image,

ImageView::SetImage() assumes that the new image is equivalent and

returns early, without repainting the ImageView.



There are two problems with this:

1. There is no guarantee that those pixel values have not been changed;

the fact that the buffer's address is the same does not mean the

image data hasn't been modified.

2. That pointer may outlive the actual underlying image. When

::SetImage() is called, it overwrites the gfx::ImageSkia which the

raw bitmap pointer came from, but the raw pointer isn't invalidated

until the ImageView is actually repainted (which happens

asynchronously). During the interim, the pointer is dangling,

although I don't see a way it can be used during that window.



This change removes the optimization entirely, since it is not clear

that it is useful. Callers should reasonably expect that a call to

SetImage() will lead to a repaint and arrange not to call SetImage()

repeatedly with the same image, rather than ImageView trying to detect

and optimize for that case.



Bug: 1469136

Change-Id: I9a95605158d90fdf6d6dbbb28c7a3d51379aaf45

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4750239

Commit-Queue: Elly FJ

entry.title: [iOS] Handle badged items in overflow menu customization
entry.content:
This CL has the menu store the data on the current active badges so it

knows how long they've been displayed and when to move items around for

them.



The main changes are in a new function for applying badge changes, as

it was too complicated to change the old function with flags. The first main difference from the old rules are that now, instead of applying

destination usage history and then badging, now if badging has locked some items in position, destination usage history is just skipped.

Second, badges now only have special positions for their first 3

impressions (or when the user has customized the menu).

entry.title: Update beginLayer to accept parameters via an option dictionary.
entry.content:
This will allow for future extensions, allowing new parameters to be

added if we ever need to. This is the recommended JavaScript API

design, as described here:

https://w3ctag.github.io/design-principles/#prefer-dictionaries



To remove ambiguity between the options and filter dictionaries, the "filter" key has been renamed to "name", as in:

ctx.beginLayer({filter: {name: 'dropShadow'}});

entry.title: shortcuts: Support dynamic key strings for text accelerators
entry.content:
This fixes a bug where text accelerators that have Keycode

parts do not dynamically update to the user's ime. The current

set of text accelerators are not exposed to this issue but

when Chrome restarts we cache the fallback domcode strings

into a static list.



This change ensures that the KeyDisplay is always updated

with the latest ime layout.

entry.title: [infra] Enable try service accounts to trigger led real builds for CI.
entry.content:
In the chromium recipe, when a tester would be triggered in an led

build, instead of emitting a scheduler trigger, it uses led to trigger

the tester so that it will use the modified recipe bundle if there is

one. For led real builds, this currently does not work because the real

builds are run using try service accounts which do not have permissions

to create builds in the ci.shadow bucket. This adds the necessary

permissions so that the trigger should succeed.

entry.title: metrics: Support repeated samples in serialization
entry.content:
The linked bug, and a prior CL (https://crrev.com/c/4376061), both want

to be able to send a single enum to UMA multiple times. The current

implementation of this simply serializes the enum to the external

metrics file repeatedly. However, this risks running into the

SerializationUtils::kMaxMessagesPerRead limit with high usage of

repeated enums.



So, to support this, add an optional num_samples field to the

serialization format for external metrics. If it is set to something

other than 1, we read the metric as usual, but when recording to UMA,

record it the specified number of times.



To test multiple samples:

$ echo -e \

'\x30\x00\x00\x00linearhistogram\x00Platform.Mutexlox 2 10 100\x00'\

>> /var/lib/metrics/uma-events

wait 30s

check chrome://histograms/Mutexlox (should have 100 samples in bucket 2)



BUG=b:292583990

TEST=tast run forward_crbook platform.Histograms



Change-Id: I21c8af1ded78770d0e3dad9f8523c725f611922a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4743220

Commit-Queue: Miriam Zimmerman

Reviewed-by: Luc Nguyen

Reviewed-by: Ian Barkley-Yeung

entry.title: Make FencedFrameConfigs serializable.
entry.content:
There is a use case where a FencedFrameConfig object is created inside

of a cross-origin iframe, and then passed to its embedder via

postMessage() to load in a fenced frame. To support that, this CL makes

the FencedFrameConfig object serializable, which allows it to be deep

copied through structuredClone() or sent as a message in postMessage().

entry.title: vulkan: Always supply DrmFormatModifierInfo when using DRM modifiers
entry.content:
If the tiling format is VK_IMAGE_TILING_DRM_FORMAT_MODIFIER_EXT, we

need to add a VkPhysicalDeviceImageDrmFormatModifierInfoEXT in the

pNext chain or else some drivers will crash. Currently, this logic

is gated behind IS_LINUX and IS_CHROMEOS_LACROS, but there are other

platforms that use this code (IS_CHROMEOS_ASH).



This CL removes the platform ifdefs.

entry.title: Introduce AudioListenerHandler for the AudioListener class
entry.content:
To improve the current design of AudioListener, this patch abstracts

the actual audio processing code out of the AudioListener class and

create a new AudioListenerHandler class.



The change is intentionally verbose because the goal if this change

in this patch is only limited to AudioListener. Some methods are

simply forwarding calls from the call sites.



The newly written code would be the operation around "handler_" to

manage a pointer and clean up task upon destruction.



The change is mechanical, and there should be no behavioral or

logical change. The follow-up changes will focus on refactoring and

some behavioral change.



Design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pz2mN3dy2KCcXnwOdP1ePSlMHAkCX8ZzafaaZKtuT0k/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: Storage side implementation of flex-lite configuration
entry.content:
Processes and stores `EventReportWindows`, a new struct containing the

reporting window deadlines, and max event level reports as specified

in the source registration. This is used for obtaining event level

report times as well as limiting the number of event level reports

per source. This takes precedence over existing implementation but

will default to it if no config exists within the registration.



Next step is to parse the fields within the source registration and

write respective interop tests.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.CreateReportStatus7]=Replaced with

Conversions.SourceStoredStatus8 due to addition of new enum value.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SentVerboseDebugReportType2]=Replaced

with Conversions.SentVerboseDebugReportType3 due to addition of new enum

value.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Conversions.SourceStoredStatus4]=Replaced with

Conversions.SourceStoredStatus5 due to addition of new enum value.

entry.title: Reland "[webauthn] Refactor cable pairings"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 98af46a1707de438ba75ccc7821df43500a8c95e.



An array of ints was left uninitialized on tests which tripped up MSAN.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[webauthn] Refactor cable pairings"

>

> This reverts commit e067c261a6e997238f155823761b90df98f52d85.

>

> Reason for revert: Suspected culprit for Linux MSan failures starting from https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37570/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > [webauthn] Refactor cable pairings

> >

> > Chrome maintains two lists of paired phones for a webauthn request: one

> > on cablev2::Discovery and another on AuthenticatorRequestDialogModel.

> > This CL updates Chrome to maintain a single list on

> > AuthenticatorRequestDialogModel instead. Callbacks taking indices are

> > replaced by callbacks taking Pairing objects instead.

> >

> > This will make passing cable pairing data to Windows easier (see

> > follow-up).

entry.title: Preserve the Last Installer API values in the registry on uninstall
entry.content:
The updater now copies and retains the last installer result values as a

backup under the `UPDATER_KEY`, and the values under the `UPDATER_KEY`

are not deleted when the updater uninstalls itself. The MSI installer

uses this information to display the installer result in cases where an

error occurs during app installation and no other apps are installed,

and the updater immediately uninstalls itself and deletes the

`ClientState` registry key under which the last installer results are

usually stored.



Bug: 1159158,1465914

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/V4L2StatefulVD: support |client_|s depleted poool
entry.content:
Sometimes V4L2StatefulVD finds its |client_|s video frame pool empty

(this happens after a resolution change event, usually). In this

cases, this CL teaches the code to request a callback via

NotifyWhenFrameAvailable().



This basically was added to fix inter/vp80-03-segmentation-1425.ivf

which sometimes jammed (there is a race between the VideoFramePool

dropping resources and allocating new ones and V4L2StatefulVD asking

for them in TryAndEnqueueCAPTUREQueueBuffers()).



Interestingly, the same test vector also pointed out that QC Venus

sometimes has two events bundled (data available and resolution

change). This CL also adds support for that, to fix the same test

vector.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:linux-v4l2-codec-rel

entry.title: [DevTools] Add 'generateTaggedPDF' option to DevTools Page.printToPDF
entry.content:
DevTools protocol Page.printToPDF method has lots of useful

parameters, however, there is no parameter to specify whether

resulting PDF should include accessibility info (PDF tagging

in PDF speak).



Since PDF accessibility info may be quite large, it is useful to

have the ability to control PDF tagging on per Page.printToPDF

call basis.



This CL adds 'generate_tagged_pdf' option to Page.printToPDF and

plumbs it all the way down to the printing code via new optional

'generate_tagged_pdf' member in PrintParams of print.mojom.



Note: this change does not affect Chrome's print to PDF

functionality -- it will still generate tagged PDFs according

to PrintRenderFrameHelper::Delegate::ShouldGenerateTaggedPDF()

return value. Only PDFs created by DevTools Page.printToPDF

method are affected.



Bug: 1469961

Change-Id: I4af95c5809f2659d62c3c9de25d3f0e44908fc86

entry.title: geolocation: Fix for system permission bubble
entry.content:
If geolocation access is allowed at the site level but

blocked by a system level permission, a bubble is shown

that directs the user to the appropriate system settings

dialog.



In some cases, the permission state is incorrectly deduced

and the wrong bubble is shown. The bubble is not intended

to be shown in this context and contains conflicting

information, indicating that location is both denied and

allowed.



The bug is caused by using PageSpecificContentSettings's

IsContentAllowed and IsContentBlocked methods to determine

the content setting. These methods combine the site level

and system level permissions, indicating geolocation is

blocked if either permission is denied.



To fix this, read the content setting from the profile's

HostContentSettingsMap and display the bubble whenever the

content setting is allowed but the system permission is

not allowed.



Bug: 1419797

Change-Id: Ibd6ad226dcf6c557cb446c1926780a07e27dd514

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4740713

around issues.

entry.title: Improve testing of optionals for SystemAccess*PrintBrowserTest
entry.content:
Currently, checks in various PrintBrowserTests for absl::optional

either:



1) Does 2 checks for has_value() and value()

or

2) Only check has_value() without checking the actual value()



Case (1) is a bit cumbersome, while case (2) is likely an unintentional

gap in test coverage. Fix these cases with gMocks's testing::Optional().



Also simplify a base::OnceCallback check to avoid a double negative.
